hero.title: Guide des Meilleurs Digimon de Départ pour Time Stranger
hero.subtitle: Analyse complète des Digimon de départ, chemins d'évolution et stratégies de début de jeu
hero.author: Par l'équipe DTS

intro.paragraph1: Choosing your first Digimon partner in Digimon Story: Time Stranger is one of the most important decisions you'll make in your journey. While you'll eventually have access to hundreds of Digimon, your starter will carry you through the critical early game hours and set the foundation for your team composition.
intro.paragraph2: In this comprehensive guide, we'll analyze all available starter options, their evolution paths, stat distributions, and ideal team synergies. Whether you're a returning Digimon veteran or brand new to the series, this guide will help you make an informed choice that matches your playstyle.

quickRecs.title: TL;DR - Quick Recommendations
quickRecs.bestOverall: Best Overall: Agumon - Excellent balanced stats, strong evolution path, beginner-friendly
quickRecs.bestSpeed: Best for Speed: Veemon - High speed stat, versatile evolutions, great for outpacing enemies
quickRecs.bestDefense: Best for Defense: Guilmon - Tank build, excellent HP and DEF scaling

mechanics.title: Understanding Starter Mechanics
mechanics.intro: Before diving into specific recommendations, it's crucial to understand how starter Digimon work in Time Stranger:
mechanics.statBonus: Permanent Stat Bonus: Your starter receives a permanent +5% bonus to all base stats, making it slightly stronger than the same Digimon obtained later.
mechanics.abiGrowth: Faster ABI Growth: Starters gain ABI (Ability) points 20% faster, reaching evolution requirements sooner.
mechanics.bondMove: Special Bond Move: After reaching Champion stage, your starter unlocks a unique signature move not available to other Digimon of the same species.
mechanics.memoryEfficiency: Memory Efficiency: Your starter costs -2 Memory in team composition, allowing for more flexible team building.

agumon.name: Agumon - The Perfect All-Rounder
agumon.description: Agumon is the quintessential starter choice and has been a franchise favorite since the original Digimon World. In Time Stranger, Agumon excels in all areas without significant weaknesses.
strengths: Balanced stat distribution perfect for beginners
Strong offensive capabilities with Fire-type moves
Clear evolution path to WarGreymon (top-tier Mega)
Learns Pepper Breath early for strong early damage
Excellent synergy with most team compositions
weaknesses: Fire typing weak to Water (common early-game)
agumon.evolutionTip: Evolution Tip: Wait until Level 16 to evolve to Greymon after learning Claw Swipe.

veemon.name: Veemon - The Speed Demon
veemon.description: Veemon is the ideal choice for players who value speed and versatility. With the highest Speed stat among starters and multiple evolution branches, Veemon offers exceptional tactical flexibility.
strengths: Highest Speed stat (60 base) among all starters
Excellent for competitive play and speedrun strategies
Free attribute makes it neutral to most matchups
Can pivot team composition based on evolution choice
weaknesses: Lower HP and DEF compared to other starters
Some evolution paths are harder to unlock
veemon.evolutionTip: Evolution Tip: Paildramon requires ExVeemon + Stingmon DNA Digivolution. Plan ahead.

guilmon.name: Guilmon - The Tank
guilmon.description: Guilmon is the tank specialist among starters. With exceptional HP and DEF scaling, Guilmon can take hits that would KO other Digimon, making it perfect for defensive playstyles.
strengths: Highest HP (62 base) and DEF (50 base) among starters
Can survive boss attacks in early-mid game
Evolution to Gallantmon is extremely powerful
Virus attribute effective against Vaccine bosses
Learns Rock Breaker for AOE damage
weaknesses: Lower SP.ATK makes special moves less effective
Gallantmon evolution path requires late-game items
guilmon.evolutionTip: Evolution Tip: Save "Crimson Mode" evolution for post-game content.

teamBuilding.title: Early Game Team Building Tips
teamBuilding.intro: Your starter is just the foundation. Here's how to build a balanced early-game team around each starter:
teamBuilding.agumonTip: For Agumon Starters: Add a Water-type like Gomamon or Palmon (Plant) to cover Fire's weakness. Include a support Digimon like Patamon for healing.
teamBuilding.veemonTip: For Veemon Starters: Since Veemon lacks bulk, add defensive Digimon like Armadillomon or Kotemon. Use Veemon's speed to strike first and eliminate threats.
teamBuilding.guilmonTip: For Guilmon Starters: Complement Guilmon's slow speed with fast attackers like Terriermon or Renamon. Let Guilmon tank hits while others deal damage.

evolvingEarly.title: Evolving Too Early
evolvingEarly.description: Wait until your starter learns its signature Rookie-level move before evolving. For Agumon, that's Claw Swipe at Level 16.

ignoringABI.title: Ignoring ABI Training
ignoringABI.description: ABI (Ability) points are crucial for reaching Mega evolutions. Use the DigiFarm to train ABI even when not actively using your starter.

overRelying.title: Over-Relying on Your Starter
overRelying.description: While starters are strong, don't neglect building a diverse team. Some bosses will hard counter your starter's typing.

q1.question: What is the best starter Digimon in Time Stranger?
q1.answer: Agumon is widely considered the best overall starter due to excellent stats, strong Fire-type offense, and straightforward evolution path to powerful forms like WarGreymon.

q2.question: Can I get all starters in one playthrough?
q2.answer: Yes! While you choose one starter at the beginning, you can recruit all other starter Digimon later through scanning and evolution.

q3.question: Does my starter choice affect the story?
q3.answer: Your starter choice has minor dialogue variations but does not significantly impact the main story. Choose based on playstyle preference.

q4.question: When should I evolve my starter?
q4.answer: Most starters should evolve to Champion around level 15-18. Wait until they learn their signature Rookie-level skills before evolving.

conclusion.title: Final Verdict
conclusion.paragraph1: While all starters are viable in Time Stranger, Agumon remains the safest and most beginner-friendly choice. Its balanced stats, straightforward evolution path, and powerful end-game form make it an excellent companion from start to finish.
conclusion.paragraph2: However, if you value speed and tactical depth, Veemon offers incredible versatility. For players who prefer defensive playstyles, Guilmon's tankiness is unmatched.
conclusion.paragraph3: Remember: your starter choice matters most for the first 10-15 hours of gameplay. By mid-game, you'll have access to dozens of powerful Digimon, so choose the starter that appeals to your personal playstyle and enjoy the journey!
